task_summary: Detect and grasp the white plate, then move and place it onto the red plate, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A 6-DoF xArm interacts with tabletop dishes. The objective is to pick a white plate from the workspace and place it centered on a red plate. The tree performs perception to find both plates, approaches above the white plate, computes a pinch-style grasp, executes the grasp, validates stability, navigates above the red plate, lowers until contact, places with a gentle press, releases, and retreats. Motions are time-binned and tolerances are tight to avoid slipping on smooth ceramics.
preconditions: Robot is homed and reachable workspace includes both plates
White plate and red plate are on the table and not occluded
success_criteria: White plate placed on red plate within acceptable alignment
Robot retreats to a safe pose
failure_and_recovery: Perception fails: retry detection up to 3 times
Grasp unstable: reattempt detection/approach and pick
Contact not detected when placing: lower again within depth limit
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after successful release on the red plate and retreat, or upon unrecoverable failure.

frame_3.now_evidence: First clear contact with the white plate and alignment of gripper visible.
frame_3.predicts_next: Grasp closure and lift are expected immediately after.

task_instruction: Pick up a white plate, and then place it on the red plate.

node_specs.description: Prepare gripper to approach the white plate.
Vision detection of white plate (with retry).
Go to pregrasp above the white plate.
Compute grasp for the plate rim.
Detect the target red plate (with retry).
Move above the red plate for placement.
Lower until contact with the red plate.
Place white plate onto red plate center with light press.
Back off to a safe distance.

failure_modes: Collision during approach due to misalignment
Red plate occluded or contact not sensed
recovery_strategy: Re-approach with tight tolerance if misaligned
If grasp unstable, reopen and recompute grasp
If contact not detected, lower again within max_depth
assumptions: Frames suggest grasping and lifting of the white plate around frames 3â€“4; the actual placement onto the red plate is partially occluded but the red plate becomes prominent later. We assume the final release occurs over the red plate as per instruction.

expected_success_criteria: PlaceAt completes with OpenGripper and no slip
